column2: 【a.】 unwise, without good sense 愚蠢的；笨的
column3: It would be foolish to spend money on something you can't afford.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a place where roads, lines, etc. cross each other, esp. where two roads meet（尤指两条道路的）交叉点，十字路口；（线的）交叉点
column3: Traffic lights have been placed at all major intersections.

column2: 【vt.】 1) (fml.) meet sb. without planning to 偶然碰到（某人）
column3: I first encountered him when I was studying at Cambridge.

column2: 【vt.】 2) experience sth., esp. problems or opposition 遇到，遭遇（尤指问题或反对）
column3: The more dangers we encounter, the harder should we push forward.

column2: 【vi.】look very carefully or hard at sth., esp. because you are having difficulty seeing it（尤指因看起来费劲而）凝视，盯着看
column3: I had been peering at a computer printout that made no sense at all.

column2: 【n.】[C, usu. pl.] (fml.) sb. of the same age, social class, etc. 同龄人；身份（或地位）相同的人
column3: Children compete to win the approval of their peers.

column2: 【ad.】 (esp. AmE) moving or pointing toward a higher position 向上；朝上
column3: Pointing upward, he indicated a large nest high in the tree.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a small room where you can leave your coat 衣帽间；衣帽寄存处
【n.】 [C] a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together 兽群；牧群
column3: The milkman selected the spotted cows, from among a herd of 200.

column2: 【n.】 [C, U] a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know sth., which is not learned 本能；直觉；天性
column3: Hearing the loud noise, Mary's first instinct was to hide under the blankets.

column2: [sing.] the natural tendency in people or animals to behave or think like other people or animals 群体本能（人或动物在行为或思维上从众的自然趋势）
【vt.】control or influence sth. 支配；影响；决定
column3: Circumstances dictated that they played a defensive rather than attacking game.

column2: 【v.】say words for sb. else to write down 口授；让（某人）听写
column3: She's dictating a letter to her secretary right now.

column2: 【n.】 [U] a force that causes bad things to happen 罪恶；邪恶
column3: There's always a conflict between good and evil in his plays.

column2: 【n.】 1) [C] (esp. AmE) a share in a company 股份；股票
【n.】 2) [C, U] a supply of a particular type of thing that a shop has available to sell 存货；现货
column3: We have a huge stock of quality carpets on sale.

column2: n.】 [C, usu, sing.] the business of buying and selling shares in companies and the place where this happens 证券交易（所）；股票交易（所）；股市
【n.[C, usu. sing.] 1) a situation in which people are suddenly made very anxious, and make quick decisions without thinking carefully 人心惶惶的局面；惶恐不安
column3: The magazine article is about the recent panic over the safety of baby milk.

column2: 【n.[C, usu. sing.] 2) an overwhelming feeling of fear and anxiety 恐慌；惊恐
column3: The audience were thrown into a panic when the fire started.

column2: 【n.】 [U] the belief in the existence of a god or gods, and the activities that are connected with the worship of them 宗教；宗教信仰
column3: Try to avoid as much as possible subjects such as religion, sex, or politics.

column2: 【vt.】 1) make sth. unable to operate normally 使无法正常运转
column3: The regional capital was paralyzed by a general strike.

column2: 【vt.】 2) make sb. lose the ability to move part or all of their body, or to feel it 使瘫痪；使麻痹
column3: Her legs were partly paralyzed in the crash.

column2: 【a.】 very famous and admired 非常有名的；大名鼎鼎的；传奇式的
column3: He is legendary for his fearlessness and determination.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a scientist trained in psychology 心理学家
column3: Psychologist Martin Lloyd-Elliott is also a best-selling author.

column2: 【vt.】influence sb. so that they begin to behave in an unacceptable or shocking way 使（行为等）不合情理
column3: I never had any toys since my father thought that they would warp my personal values.

column2: 【v.】become, or make sth. become, twisted or bent out of its natural shape, for example because it has become too hot, too damp, etc.（使）扭曲，弯曲，变形
column3: The window frame must have been warped; it won't close properly.

column2: 【vi.】 (~ to / with) be the same as or match sth. 相一致；符合
column3: Your account of the event does not correspond with hers.

column2: 【n.】 [U] the state of continuing to live or exist 生存；幸存
column3: The man's survival was surprising, as the doctors thought he would die.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a member of a group of people that lives by hunting and looking for plants that can be eaten, rather than by keeping animals for food or by growing crops 采猎者（以打猎和采集植物为生的人）
【vi.】 suddenly run somewhere very quickly, esp. in order to escape or because you are frightened 逃跑；跑开
column3: The thief bolted when he saw the policeman.

column2: 【v.】 rub your fingernails against your skin 抓；搔
column3: Jessica lifted her sunglasses and scratched her nose.

column2: 【vi.】 run very fast for a short distance（短距离）快速奔跑，冲刺
column3: I saw Charlie sprinting through the traffic toward me.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a part of a cell in a living thing which controls its physical characteristics, growth, and development 基因
column3: He said he was good at sports because he had the athletic gene.

column2: 【n.】 [C] sb. who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people, etc. that existed in the past 后代；后裔
column3: They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers.

column2: 【a.】 firmly fixed and unchangeable（观念、原则等）根深蒂固的
column3: The report suggests that deeply rooted cultural and social factors play a role in these behaviors.

column2: 【a.】 (of things or people) making a strong impression, because they are very large, good, skillful, etc. 给人印象深刻的
column3: The building looked as impressive in reality as it did in photographs.

column2: 【a.】 belonging to or connected with the National Socialist German Workers' Party which controlled Germany from 1933 to 1945 纳粹党的
【n.】 [U] information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them（政府或政党为了影响民意而进行的）宣传
column3: These reports clearly contain elements of propaganda.

column2: 【a.】 thorough and complete 彻底的；完全的
column3: The Football League has announced its proposals for a radical reform of the way football is run in England.

column2: 【v. 】shout sth. in a deep powerful voice 咆哮；大声喊叫
column3: It was such a great performance that the audience roared with appreciation.

column2: 【vi.】make a deep, very loud noise 吼叫；呼啸
column3: We were so afraid as we heard a lion roar.

column2: 【ad.】 namelessly; without giving a name 以匿名的方式；不透露姓名地
column3: The latest photographs were sent anonymously to the magazine's Paris headquarters.

column2: 【vi.】 (~ to) give your permission for sth., or agree to do sth. 同意；允许
column3: She asked her mother whether she would consent to a small celebration after her graduation.

column2: 【n. 】 [U] the activity or business of drawing public attention to goods and services on television, in newspapers, etc. 广告活动；广告业
column3: The advertising campaign is aimed primarily at young people.

column2: 【n.】 [C, U] sth. that causes problems and tends to stop sb. / sth. from succeeding or making progress 不利因素；缺点
column3: You have to balance the advantages of living downtown against the disadvantages.

column2: 【a.】  having doubts that a claim or statement is true or that sth. will happen 怀疑的；心存疑惑的
column3: They are skeptical about my chances of winning.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a person who writes novels 小说家
column3: Mark Twain has been regarded as the greatest American novelist of his generation.

column2: 【n.】[U] 1)  a system for moving people from place to place 交通运输系统
column3: The president wants to improve the nation's highway and mass transit system.

column2: 【n.】[U] 2) the process of moving goods or people from one place to another （货物或人的）运输
column3: They promised that my baggage would not be damaged in transit.

column2: 【vt.】 change sth. into a different form, or change sth. so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way 使转变；使转化；使改造
column3: This device can be used to convert a signal into a digital code.

column2: 【n.】 [C] the first design of sth. from which other forms are copied or developed 原型；雏形；最初形态
column3: We plan to release a prototype this autumn for trial in hospitals.

column2: 【vt.】 (input, input; inputted, inputted) put information into a computer （向计算机）输入
column3: All call center staff do is input data into computers and so it makes every sense that you do it yourself to cut cost.

column2: 【n.】 [C] 智能手机
【a.】 (only before noun) found or used now 目前的；现存的
column3: Under existing regulations, you are not allowed to bring animals into the country.

column2: 【a.】 relating to or done using the Web (the system of connected documents on the Internet) 基于网络的
column3: With the new web-based software, creating a purchase order should take just a few minutes.

column2: 【n.】 [C, U] a system of words, letters, numbers, or symbols that represent a message or record information secretly or in a shorter form 密码；暗码；电码；代码
column3: He received a message written in code yesterday and he didn't know what to do about it.

column2: 【a.】 (only before noun) connected with a large or capital city 大城市的；大都会的
column3: This is an issue that should be decided by local and metropolitan governments.

column2: 【a.】 (only before noun) of or being the very rapid use, handling, or showing of information by a computer 即时处理的；实时的
column3: We are designing a secure and real-time voice transmission system.

column2: 【n.】 [C] used in the names of streets in a town or city 街；大街
column3: When we visited New York, we stayed in a hotel on Fifth Avenue.

column2: 【a.】 successful, and working in the way that was intended 有效的；产生预期效果的
column3: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating this disease.

column2: 【v.】 think or guess that sth. is smaller, cheaper, easier, etc. than it really is 低估；（对···）估计不足；看轻
column3: None of us should ever underestimate the degree of difficulty women face in career advancement.

column2: 【n.】 [C] a moment when you suddenly realize or understand sth. important 顿悟的时刻
column3: People are all familiar with the story of Issac Newton's epiphany about gravity (地球引力) and a falling apple.

column2: 【a.】 (only before noun) becoming old; rather old 变老的；陈旧的
column3: We need to replace some of the aging office equipment.

column2: 【n.】 1) [C] a building or an area with a roof over it that protects you from the weather or from danger 躲避风雨的地方；避难处
column3: They built a rough shelter from old pieces of wood.

column2: 【n.】 2) [U] a place to live, considered as one of the basic needs of life 栖身之地；住处
column3: They were in need of food and shelter after the earthquake.

column2: n.】 [C] (BrE) a small structure with a roof where you wait for a bus 公共汽车候车亭
【a.】 powered by energy from sunlight 太阳能驱动的
column3: The company is developing a fully solar-powered car.

column2: 【a.】 (only before noun) relating to a town or city 城镇的；城市的
column3: The president's visit was the most important civic event of the year.

column2: 【vt.】 (fml.) make sth. less severe or extreme 使缓和；使温和；冲淡
column3: The heat in this coastal town is tempered by the cool sea breeze (微风).

column2: 【vt.】 put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used 安装，设置（设备）
column3: It would cost about £3,000 to install a new heating system in a flat such as theirs.

column2: 【n.】 [C, usu. sing.] the journey to work every day 上下班路程
column3: I want to rent an apartment near my office because my daily commute takes too long.

column2: 【n.】 [C] the head of the government of a town or city, etc., elected by the public （民选的）市长，镇长
column3: The crowd gathered in the town square to hear the mayor speak.

column2: 【a.】 (not before noun) feeling doubt about sth. 不确定的；没把握的；拿不准的
column3: It's still uncertain whether the College Spring Sports will be held this year.

column2: 【a.】 positive and making you feel that good things will happen 乐观的；积极向上的
column3: New research shows that all it may take to avoid this common disease is a positive and upbeat attitude.

column2: 【ad.】 on the way 在路上；在途中
column3: We stopped for a picnic en route.

column2: 【n.】 [C] 吊车；起重机
【n.】 [C] (fml.) sth. sb. does, esp. sth. that is very good or very bad（尤指很好或很坏的）行为，行动
column3: His heroic deeds were celebrated in every corner of the city.

column2: 【vt.】 cause sth. to start or develop, esp. suddenly 引发；触发
column3: Will the rapid rise in oil prices spark another crisis?

column2: take part in an activity with other people 加入，参加（活动）
column3: Now and again he'd join in when we were playing video games.

column2: used to introduce an explanation of sth. 换言之；换句话说；也就是说
column3: In other words, we have to build different ways of working.

column2: used to talk about a series of similar things or events that are done or happening with very little time between them 一个接一个
column3: One after another, people described how hard it was for them to get medical care.

column2: stay in the original place 留在原地
column3: Nigel says for the moment he is very happy to stay put in London.

column2: consider sth. carefully so that you can make a decision about it 权衡；仔细考虑
column3: You have to weigh up in your mind whether to pursue your goal or not.

column2: at a time in the future 过后；后来
column3: I hate to rush you but I have another appointment later on.

column2: become even more unpleasant, difficult, etc. 每况愈下；越来越糟
column3: For the past couple of years my health has gone from bad to worse.

column1: make a, no, some, etc. difference
column2: have an effect  sth. 有（或没有、有些等）作用，关系，影响
column3: The new central heating has made an enormous difference to the house.

column2: operating normally 正常运转
column3: We're trying to get the medical facilities up and running again.

column2: telephone a radio or television program with a comment or question 打电话到（电台、电视台）
column3: It's a hot topic, and people have been calling in all morning.

column2: make sure that sth. is actually true, correct, or acceptable 核实；查证；调查
column3: Maybe we ought to go down to the library and check it out.

column2: pull or knock down a building, wall, etc. 拆毁，拆除（建筑物、墙等）
column3: The city government has decided to tear down several buildings and create a park.

column2: (also 'sb. can't help but do sth.') used to say that sb. is unable to change their behavior, or feelings, or to prevent themselves from doing sth. 某人忍不住做某事；某人不能停止做某事
column3: In fact, I can't help wondering what someone with your experience is doing in a place like this.

column2: decide that sb. 某事无用（不重要，失败）
column3: It's too soon to write off the project as a failure.

column2: drive to the side of the road and stop your car, bike, etc. or make sb. else do this （使）车辆停靠在路边
column3: The police signaled to him to pull over and gave him a drunk driving test.
